cab.content: 6(P. 7300) From Secretary of State to Viceroy, Foreign Department,ord November 1920.3029. Your telegram of 29th September, 1154 S. Afghan Treaty. Please see correspondence with Board of Trade sent by mail of 4th November, and telegraph your observations. As regards clause 4 (h), see my Revenue Secretary's letter R. and S. 8451 of 7th October to Barnes.As regards clause 4 (j), intention of my telegram of 17th August was"to point out that terms of concession, as stated in your telegram of 30th July, appear to. prohibit all exports of Afghan opium to countries signatory of Hague Convention, but at the same time to admit of unrestricted export to all non-signatory countries. Would it not be desirable to amend proviso in clause 4- (j) to read somewhat as follows: " Provided that such opium or charas shall only be despatched to countries which have adhered to Hague Convention, and that despatches from India shall be made strictly in accordance with provisions and principles of that Convention."
